derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English helma; probably related to helve
Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch helm and German Helm, also to helmet, from an Indo-European root meaning 'to cover or hide'

entry.def: The helm of a boat or ship is the part that is used to steer it.

example.ex: I got into our dinghy while Willis took the helm and positioned the boat for the photograph.
example.tran: 我钻进我们的小艇，威利斯掌舵，将船摆好位置准备拍照。

entry.def: You can say that someone is at the helm when they are leading or running a country or organization.

example.ex: He has been at the helm of Lonrho for 31 years.
example.tran: 他执掌伦罗公司已达31年。

example.ex: ...Yutaka Kume, who took the helm as Nissan's president in June 1985.
example.tran: 1985年6月成为日产汽车社长的久米丰

means.word_mean: 1. steering mechanism for a vessel; a mechanical device by which a vessel is steered

sentences.sentence: "the President is at the helm of the Ship of State"

auth_sentence.content: Each participant gets a chance to take the helm.
auth_sentence.res_content: Each participant gets a chance to take the helm.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Each participant gets a chance to take the helm.

auth_sentence.content: Mark Lester was finally signed to helm the movie.

auth_sentence.content: I mostly stood at the helm, looking nautical.

sentences.en: The boat seemed very slow to answer to any movement of the helm.
sentences.cn: 这只船似乎对舵的转动的反应很不灵敏。

sentences.en: Who was at the helm when the collision occurred?
sentences.cn: 当碰撞发生时,谁在掌舵?

sentences.en: The company began to make profits again with the new managing director at the helm.
sentences.cn: 新任总经理主管后，公司又开始盈利了。

sentences.en: When Mr Davies retired, his daughter took the helm.
sentences.cn: 戴维斯先生退休后，他女儿接管了公司。
